intro: Crepis alikeri, commonly known as the alikeri sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and along roadsides. It has slender stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, contributing to its role in supporting pollinators.
